meanings.definition: Causing or feeling slight pain or physical discomfort
meanings.sent1: The hard chair was uncomfortable to sit on for a long time.
meanings.sent2: The new shoes were uncomfortable until they were broken in.
meanings.sent3: Wearing a scratchy sweater made me feel uncomfortable during the party.
meanings.sent4: The tight bandage around my arm was uncomfortable, but necessary for healing.
meanings.sent5: The bumpy bus ride was so uncomfortable that I couldn't sleep.

meanings.definition: Causing or feeling unease or awkwardness
meanings.sent1: The silence in the room made everyone feel uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: He felt uncomfortable when asked to speak in front of a large crowd.
meanings.sent3: The cat's curious stare made the dog uncomfortable during playtime.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected question put her in an uncomfortable position.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the haunted house was incredibly uncomfortable.

meanings.sent1: She was uncomfortable in the unfamiliar surroundings.
meanings.sent2: The student felt uncomfortable in the new school on the first day.
meanings.sent3: The tight shoes made him uncomfortable throughout the hike.
meanings.sent4: The awkward conversation left them feeling uncomfortable.
meanings.sent5: The cold room made everyone uncomfortable during the meeting.
